Methods

__call__ Call self as a function.
chunk_iter(self, int chunk=2, int start=0, ...) iterately get Frames with start, chunk
frame_iter(self, int start=0, int stop=-1, ...) iterately get Frames with start, stop, stride
load(self[, filename, top, frame_slice]) filename : a single filename or a list of filenames
load_new(self, *args, **kwd) remove all trajectory data and load new ones
save(self[, filename, format, overwrite])
to_mutable_traj(self) same as self[:] but more explicit
write(self, *args, **kwd)
chunk_iter(self, int chunk=2, int start=0, int stop=-1, bool copy_top=False)¶

iterately get Frames with start, chunk returning Trajectory or Frame instance depend on chunk value Parameters ——— start : int (default = 0) chunk : int (default = 1, return Frame instance).

if chunk > 1 : return Trajectory instance
copy_top : bool, default=False
if False: no Topology copy is done for new (chunk) Trajectory
filelist¶
frame_iter(self, int start=0, int stop=-1, int stride=1, mask=None)¶

iterately get Frames with start, stop, stride Parameters ——— start : int (default = 0) stop : int (default = max_frames) stride : int mask : str or array of interger

load(self, filename=None, top=None, frame_slice=(0, -1, 1))¶

filename : a single filename or a list of filenames top : Topology-like object take_slice : add slice

load_new(self, *args, **kwd)¶

remove all trajectory data and load new ones

n_atoms¶

used for frame_iter

n_frames¶
save(self, filename='', format='unknown', overwrite=True, *args, **kwd)¶
size¶
to_mutable_traj(self)¶

same as self[:] but more explicit

top¶
unitcells¶
write(self, *args, **kwd)¶
xyz¶

return a copy of xyz coordinates (ndarray, shape=(n_frames, n_atoms, 3) We can not return a memoryview since Trajectory is a C++ vector of Frame object

chunk_iter(self, int chunksize=2, int start=0, int stop=-1, bool copy_top=False)¶

iterately get Frames with start, chunk returning Trajectory or Frame instance depend on chunk value Parameters ——— start : int (default = 0) chunk : int (default = 1, return Frame instance).

if chunk > 1 : return Trajectory instance
copy_top : bool, default=False
if False: no Topology copy is done for new (chunk) Trajectory

chunk_iter(self, int chunksize=2, int start=0, int stop=-1, bool copy_top=False)¶

iterately get Frames with start, chunk returning Trajectory or Frame instance depend on chunk value Parameters ——— start : int (default = 0) chunk : int (default = 1, return Frame instance).

if chunk > 1 : return Trajectory instance
copy_top : bool, default=False
if False: no Topology copy is done for new (chunk) Trajectory
